intro: Mertensia pedalis, commonly known as the purple fringed bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a fuzzy texture. Mertensia pedalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
